author: Nick Mc
comment: This is the most important app you can get for Android Wear 2. Hands down. Why? Too many reasons. First off the music controls are MONUMENTALLY better then the default. You can actually HIT THE BUTTONS. I don't think I need to tell anyone using Android Wear 2 that the default screen controller is extremely hard to hit, especially while driving. This brings me to my next point, physical button support. Why have so few apps integrated this?? It's true there's a lot of watches that only have the one button, which isn't really rebindable since it's needed for critical wear navigation. But what about those of us who saw the value of a second bindable physical button and went out of our way to buy one that did? We were left with a mediocre means of customization, one app, single click. Music center answers that problem too, not only does it finally allow us to CONTEXTUALLY bind single, double and even LONG press as a physical button for music controls, a must while driving. It also allows us to bind Tasker or other apps as well. All while within the app on the watch. Because the best part is, once we leave the app, it goes back to our original default, just like you'd imagine. This has completely remade my Android Wear experience and I may have to donate money to this dev because he is my hero. 😀  Sorry, I'm just genuinely excited how much this fixes for me.

author: Dave Feltham
comment: Great and beautiful way to easily see and control what you're listening to. Dev is communicative and addressed the two major issues I had with the latest release!

reply.author: matejdro
reply.content: You can select which apps show up in the settings

author: Chris Kerry
comment: Great app. And great developer. Responded to my email next day and fixed issue.

author: Chris Locke
comment: Awesome app!! Had some bugs but the developer updated the code on git hub the same day. Waiting for an update now! Make sure to report bugs in settings!

author: Candan BÖLÜKBAŞ
comment: Ad-free, open source, perfect! You should have this in order to take the full advantage of your Android Wear.

author: Vajon Lim
comment: This app is amazing... Like no kidding would strongly recomend

author: Eslam Ayman
comment: All what u need in an app to control the music on your phone AND FOR FREE. Thank u.

author: Nico Hi
comment: good idea and good interface, but you can't skip tracks in Apple music...

author: Giuliano Fichera
comment: Perfect app and even better dev! Very responsive and open to suggestions!

author: Ahmed Zaki-us-Saleheen
comment: amazing app...makes my android wear nearly perfect...

author: Cv Ofilada
comment: This is an awesome app!!!!! Hope you guys download it!

author: Adil khokhar
comment: Spent ages looking for this, works perfect  - wanted to use hardware buttons to change music on android wear just like I have been used to on my old pebble watch.  If i didn't find this app I probably would have tried making it myself and failed.

author: Luke Boger
comment: Almost exactly what I'm looking for. Love that it auto switches and can easily shoe what I want from Google Music. Just two things that I would need to see to be able to compete with Music Boss: thumbs up/thumbs down options and ability to control SiriusXM. Really solid base here, though. Love the Tasker support, too!

reply.author: matejdro
reply.content: Could you shoot me an email regarding your suggestion, so we can talk more about the details?

author: Markus Pawlata
comment: Switching from Pebble to Wear (I have a ticwatch), I was looking for a good music remote. This is easy to use, reasonably easy to configure and works almost without delay.

author: Dave Apel
comment: Love this app, clean and simple! Maybe make time display a little larger, no am/pm?

author: Chris Rodriguez
comment: This app is awesome, works as a perfect bridge between my Bluetooth earbuds, and in car stereo.

author: Dan Reese
comment: This app is perfect. I love it!
